Dear Ms. Shillings:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Behavior management
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff pushed a youth down after he threw a ball at her.
Investigation Chief Administrator emailed DCWL on 5/28/24 to report the
alleged incident. Chief Administrator reported that she received a
grievance form from Youth A, regarding a former staff. The
grievance form indicated Youth A was pushed to the ground by
Staff 1. Youth A reportedly threw a ball at Staff 1, before being
pushed. Video of the incident was available.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
5/30/24. Chief Administrator reported the alleged incident
occurred on 5/23/24. However, due to the long holiday weekend
Chief Administrator did not become aware of the incident until
5/28/24 when she arrived at the facility and found grievance forms
from Youth A and Youth B. Chief Administrator reported that Staff
1 was terminated and Staff 2 was placed on administrative leave
pending investigation. Chief Administrator acknowledged that staff
should have reported the incident to central intake as required.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/30/24.
Youth A reported that he recalled the incident but not the date of
it. Youth A stated Staff 1 was arguing with his brother (Youth B)
outside. Youth A did not like how Staff 1 was speaking to Youth B.
Youth A stated that Staff 1 was telling Youth B who he should be
and causing Youth B to feel stressed. Youth A stated he tried to
tell Staff 1 that she was not being helpful. Staff 1 told Youth A to
go away, then proceeded to glare at him. Youth A told Staff 1 to
stop staring at him, but she would not stop. Youth A then threw
the ball at Staff 1 as he walked toward her. Staff 1 then reached
2

out and grabbed Youth A, throwing him to the ground. Staff 1 was
swearing and yelling at Youth A while he was on the ground.
Youth B then threw a walkie-talkie at Staff 1. Additional staff
intervened and separated everyone. Youth A reported he did not
have any injuries and did not require medical attention. Youth A
reported he never had an issue with Staff 1 before. Youth A stated
he never had any problems with other staff and overall felt safe at
the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/30/29.
Youth B recalled that he was arguing with Staff 1 that day, when
Youth A tried to intervene. Youth A told Staff 1 to leave Youth B
alone. Staff 1 became confrontational with Youth A, asking if he
wanted to argue with her. Youth A walked away and Staff 1
followed, telling Youth A to come back and argue with her. Youth
A told Staff 1 to leave him alone. Staff 1 then grabbed Youth A
and pushed him to the ground. Youth B stated Staff 1 continued
yelling at Youth A while he laid on the ground. Staff 3 dropped a
walkie talkie on the ground while trying to block Youth B from
getting involved. Youth B picked up the walkie talkie and threw it
at Staff 1. Additional staff intervened and separated everyone.
Youth B stated he does not like being at the facility, as he feels
staff are too strict. Youth B stated that Staff 1 had always been
rude prior to this incident. Youth B stated he never saw Staff 1 put
their hands on anyone prior to this.
Youth C was present during the incident but could not be
interviewed as he was AWOL.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility. Staff 3 reported
being present and speaking with Youth B when the situation
began. Youth B was having negative thoughts and Staff 1 was
trying to lighten his mood. Youth A then tried to insert himself in
the conversation and began yelling at staff to stop talking to Youth
B. Staff 1 replied to Youth A, "we're not talking to you". Youth A
then threw a pack of skittles at Staff 1. Staff 1 picked up the candy
and gave it to Youth B. Youth A became upset and threw a ball at
Staff 1. Youth A then charged at Staff 1 and began hitting her.
Staff 1 pushed Youth A to the ground. Youth A began kicking at
Staff 1. Staff 3 walked over and helped Youth A off the ground. In
the process, his walkie talkie fell to the ground. Youth B picked up
the walkie talkie and threw it at Staff 1, hitting her in the chest. The
youth were removed from the area at that time. Staff 1 was upset,
but calm. Staff 3 stated that Staff 1 is well liked by the kids and
able to control her emotions. Staff 3 had never witnessed Staff 1
become physical with youth before.
3

Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/30/24. Staff
4 reported that he was outside with the group on the day of the
incident. However, he had his back to the situation and did not see
anything. Staff 4 stated he heard some commotion, turned around
and saw Youth B throw a walkie talkie at Staff 1. Youth A was
swinging his hands at Staff 1. From Staff 4's perspective, it
appeared two kids were ganging up on staff. Staff 4 did not know
what started the incident. Staff 4 stated he never had prior
concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed by phone on 6/12/24. Staff 2 stated she
had just come on shift for the day, when the group moved out to
the garden. Staff 2 observed Staff 1 and Youth B arguing and
swearing at one another. Staff 2 redirected Youth B about his
language but did not feel comfortable telling Staff 1 to stop
swearing and yelling. Youth A then approached Staff 1 and yelled
at her. Staff 1 pushed Youth A to the ground. Staff 2 stated she
was in disbelief about what happened and knew that Staff 1
should have handled the situation differently. Staff 2 then saw a
walkie talkie was thrown at Staff 1. However, she did not see who
threw it.
Staff 1 was interviewed by phone on 6/12/24. Staff 1 stated that
on 5/23/24, she was in the garden with a few staff and youth. Staff
1 was talking to Staff 3 and Youth B. Staff 1 could not recall what
the conversation was, but stated they were not arguing. Youth A
then approached and began yelling at Staff 1. Youth A was upset
at Staff 1 for talking to his brother, Youth B. Staff 1 told Youth B to
ignore Youth A. Youth A then threw candy at Staff 1. Staff 1
picked up the candy and gave it to Youth B. While Staff 1 was
walking away, Youth A ran up and swung his fist at her. Staff 1
pushed Youth A and he fell to the ground. Youth B then threw a
basketball and hit Staff 1 in the chest. Staff then worked together
to clear the area and separate everyone.
Video Reviewed:
Staff 1 walked around the left side of the picnic table. Youth A
walked around the right side of the table and approached Staff 1.
Youth A threw a small, green ball at Staff 1. The ball went over
Staff 1’s head. Staff 1 used her right hand and grabbed Youth A
by the shoulder/neck and pushed him to the ground. Staff 1 then
stood over Youth A, while he attempted to kick her. Staff 3 then
approached. Youth B was observed to approach and throw a
walkie talkie, striking Staff 1. Staff 4 and Staff 5 then approached
and walked away from the area with Staff 3, Youth A and Youth B.
4

Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A grievance form- On 5/23/24 Youth A was walking
away from Staff 1. Youth A told Staff 1 to stop following
him. Staff 1 then grabbed Youth A by the neck/shoulder
and pushed him to the ground, then yelled at him.
• Youth B grievance form- On 5/23/24 Youth B witnessed
Staff 1 grab and shove Youth A to the ground.
• Staff 2 written statement- The statement was written on
5/30/24 and was consistent with what was reported in the
interview with Staff 2.
• Staff 3 written statement- The statement was consistent
with what was reported in the interview with Staff 3.
However, Staff 3 added that Youth A grabbed Staff 1 by the
waist and was punching her, prior to Staff 1 pushing the
youth.
• Staff 5 written statement- The statement was written on
5/29/24. Staff 5 reported that he witnessed Staff 1 push
Youth A to the ground. Staff 5 also witnessed Youth B
throw a walkie talkie at Staff 1. Staff 5 did not see what the
cause of the situation was.
• Staff 1 Human Resources file held documentation of
restraint training that was completed on 12/19/2023.
• Staff 2 Human Resources file held documentation of
restraint training that was completed on 5/14/2024.
• Staff 3 Human Resources file held documentation of
restraint training that was completed on 4/2/2024.
• Staff 5 Human Resources file held documentation of
restraint training that was completed on 2/20/2024.
• Wolverine Center Behavior Support and Management
Policy. All staff are certified in Crisis Prevention Institute
(CPI) Non-violent Crisis Intervention.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as interviews and video
footage verified that Staff 1 pushed Youth A to the ground. Staff
1’s action did not follow the CPI training provided by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Established

Rule Code Compliance with child protection law; development of plan
Title required.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
Description assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The agency did not make a timely report of suspected abuse or
neglect.
Investigation Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
5/30/24. Chief Administrator reported the alleged incident
occurred on 5/23/24. However, due to the long holiday weekend
Chief Administrator did not become aware of the incident until
5/28/24. Chief Administrator acknowledged that staff should have
reported the incident to central intake as required by the child
protection law.
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 5 all reported observing Staff 1 push
Youth A to the ground. However, none of these staff made a
report to central intake.
Documents Reviewed
• Staff 2 Human Resources file held documentation of Child
Protection Law training completed on 5/9/2024.
• Staff 3 Human Resources file held documentation of Child
Protection Law training completed on 4/4/2024.
• Staff 5 Human Resources file held documentation of Child
Protection Law training completed on 2/27/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as three staff witnessed
the event and did not follow their training as mandated reporters.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024C0001139SI dated 3/11/24, CAP approved 4/9/24.

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
